page.title: 03Occupations in St. John
page.content:
We carried out a survey of the occupations of the fathers of all the children in St. John's Primary School. We found that out of 50 workers, there were 7 in the{building trade,}4 {electricians,}4{shopkeepers,}4 {engineers,}3{gardeners,}3{teachers,}3 {salesmen,}2{civil servants,}2{postmen, 2{barmen,}2{caretakers}and 2 {emergency service workers.}There was also an{architect,}an{accountant,}a {farmer,}a{banker,}an{artist,}a{groom, a{poultry station employee,}a{chef,}a {quarryman,}and a{mathematician.}
Despite the fact that much of the area is farming land it seems that few of the local population are employed on the farms. Many of the farm workers are of French and Portuguese origin.
